website_summaries.verdict: There's nothing fancy about this air mattress, but it keeps you off the ground. As one reviewer put it, eventually, all air mattresses leak, and I'd rather pay less than $20 several times than pay $70 several times.
pros: Plush flocked top is comfortable and keeps sheets in place
Compact for storage.Extra wide valve openings for fast inflating and deflating
cons: Doesn't come with an air pump

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Took this out this weekend and tried it out. Comfortably sleeps two people, and fits standard full/queen size sheets. I have a Coleman Sundome 3 person tent, and this mattress fits in the tent just right. No leaks and from what I could tell it did not lose and pressure at all after one night. I like that it isn't one of the really tall ones, because it is significantly less to inflate. Also, we stayed plenty warm - even though the ground was pretty cold, we couldn't tell!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Packs up nicely, firm and comfortable when blown up
customer_reviews.text: Packs up nicely, firm and comfortable when blown up. We use it in our tent when car camping. It will lose air overnight when it is cooler (65 F and lower) and if you don't have a good blanket as a layer between it and the tent floor condensation will collect inside it and make your sheets damp. But it dries out quickly and if you get the rechargeable pump with it, it's a quick easy refill. Good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like a blast from the 1970's past
customer_reviews.text: Remember why we stopped sleeping on waterbeds? If you don't remember, sleeping on an air mattress will jog your memory real quick. The problem of course is that when one person moves, the other person on the mattress will also move. There is no isolation of movement like on a real mattress. Therefore if you have somebody who rolls around on the mattress a lot, any other occupant will bounce around all night too. Thus nobody got a good night's sleep. And the air pretty much all leaked out by morning even though it was brand new. Will save it for inlaws when they come to visit.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lai

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Have used this airbed both indoors and test camping outdoors. Inflates and deflates easily. Modest pressure loss during overnight camping was expected as temperatures had gotten into the 40's. Does the job as a fraction of the cost of fancier units.
customer_reviews.author: RKW442

customer_reviews.title: Holds air after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality air mattress. It's rare it gets used but there are no rips and it stays inflated. I use it in carpet so I haven't tested it camping or something. The fabric is soft and comfy so it doesn't feel like you sleep on plastic. A queen size fitted sheet fits on it. I had a bad back injury and put this on top of my normal bed which is a firm mattress. This created a raised bed so it helped a lot getting in and out of bed.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: After reading countless good and bad reviews for several air mattresses I decided to just go with the cheap Intex Queen size. I figured if I used more than a handful of times and it held up I would be satisfied considering the price. I followed the instructions to inflate the bed 72 hours before first use to allow the mattress to stretch. I slept on it with my toddler and we were both comfy and cozy. It doesn't come with a carry bag which is sort of a let down b/c I could not fit it back in the original box again for storage purposes. Overall I am pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mrsjoeyd

customer_reviews.title: It's $20. Don't get upset if it starts going flat after a few weeks of use.
customer_reviews.text: Started losing air after a few weeks of use. It would stay inflated most of the night, but by the time I woke up, it had obviously deflated. I was using this as a temporary mattress until I could get my actual mattress out of storage into my apartment. For $20, it did its job so I can't be too mad. Probably wouldn't be bad to have if you have kids that want to make a bed out in the living room, or your in-laws need a place to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Slept like a baby!
customer_reviews.text: Finally used this 1 year after buying it. ***Note, it doesn’t come with an air pump. It was super comfy and lasted 2 nights without needing to be re-inflated. It did lose some air but it was still comfy enough to sleep on without me going through the hassle of adding more air. For the price I highly recommend it. I had a $150 one from bed bath and beyond that lost more air than this cheaper one. I slept like a baby in my sleeping bag. Zzz
customer_reviews.author: Estella

customer_reviews.title: hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: We ordered two of these assuming one wouldn't work and that is certainly how it turned out. I patched one of them two separate times, but it is still leaking air like it was when we first got it. I spent a few days filling them up and letting them sit in the garage to "stretch" like it recommended, but oh well. The other one works perfectly. No patching after two camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen l hamann

customer_reviews.title: Great investment to me
customer_reviews.text: I read plenty reviews both good and bad so here's my take. 5 stars and maybe I got the best mattress out apparently but no leaks, deflation or bubbles. I'm 6'5 305 and been using almost 1 year without any issues. My original mattress I gave to my ex for my so. when we split and decided to start fresh and get a new bed but havent even thought about it because this air mattress been so comfy with me. To each it's own but I havent had a complaint or problem yet.
customer_reviews.author: Veryeducated

customer_reviews.title: The Airbed was comfortable enough when fully inflated but needed to add air ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this Airbed on a camping trip in April. Slept in a tent and placed the Airbed on a collapsible frame.Had to add air twice a day for four days. The Airbed was comfortable enough when fully inflated but needed to add air every morning. If I took a nap in the afternoon, I added air and always added air at night.There was quite a change in the temperatures outdoors from 70 degrees to 30 degrees. Might be this Airbed is designed for indoor use.
customer_reviews.author: arnie

customer_reviews.title: Kick ass, lasted 6 mos
customer_reviews.text: This is a questionably low price, but we've used this air bed a TON over the 6mos we've had it. Had house guests in and out for months. Cats playing on it. Jumping kids... Never lost air overnight, never showed any signs of leaking overnight or over the course of weeks of use... until just recently. For $14 it feels ok bc now I can just buy another :) Highly recommend the power air pump made to compliment it by same company.
customer_reviews.author: Osigalas

customer_reviews.title: Don't Believe the Description
customer_reviews.text: These beds are horrible...don't believe the instructions that state that the beds will deflate a little when new but will hold firmness once they are "broken in" I have had these for a while but have only used them a few times. They have NEVER maintained air. Obviously the return period is over and I can't get my money back. So PLEASE DO NOT BUY THESE BEDS...! THEY ARE HORRIBLE...!
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: This was so comfortable at first, but it was barely over a month before the inside panels began to burst and cause huge, uncomfortable bubbles of air. Eventually, all the seams fall apart and it turns into an unusable blob. The entire thing ended up being useless.
customer_reviews.author: Gared SparrowsonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: they work great! We used them for 2 nights and no ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these to test out, then another 2 for camping. We have a 10 person tent, so 3 of these fit with some extra room. It was very important to stretch out the material as the instructions say, but after the stretching, they work great! We used them for 2 nights and no sinking. I think they are a tad bit smaller than a queen mattress, probably more of a full size. Still a great mattress for camping or a guests stay
customer_reviews.author: Charlo

customer_reviews.title: Sufficient enough, walmart has this cheaper.
customer_reviews.text: It is sufficient enough if you need to use it for unexpected guest. It isn't for a long term solution type of thing. If you are looking at this item because you are looking for a cheap air matress for unexpected guest, I can tell you that this is good enough and if you don't mind driving out to walmart, they are selling this very same air matress for $15. The latch isn't secure enough and that is why air leaks out bit by bit.
customer_reviews.author: Felly

customer_reviews.title: interior vertical walls separated twice while still almost new
customer_reviews.text: Great product until out of the blue the internal walls that form the column shaped surface start to separate... even when no one is using the unit (so not due to undue air pressure)... basically just inflated mattress and several days later a small bulge formed on sleeping surface, then grew on its own until so big unit unusable. Tiny problem but huge consequence that renders unit worthless. too bid Intex couldn't spend pennies more to secure the wall against normal air pressure needed to inflate the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wipe Off Before Using
customer_reviews.text: These come coated with dye or other chemicals that come off and stain anything they come in contact with. Wiping them down with wet paper towels removes most of it, and seems to cure this problem. The color remains the same, just the loose manufacturing residue is removed from the surface. These are actually quite comfortable with a 3" foam topper added. I'd pay more for longer-lasting materials, but it's hard to find a high-quality low-profile mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Harkin

customer_reviews.title: Seems good but instructions are inadequate in one respect.
customer_reviews.text: This mattress initially appeared to leak. However, I found and fixed the problem which is the fact that it has a valve that turns to close but absolutely nothing in the instructions that mentioned the valve. I have had other air mattresses in the past that had friction caps but no valve so I was not expecting a valve. I have adjusted my score to four stars and would have given five except for the confusion due to non-existent instructions.
customer_reviews.author: charles cicciarella

customer_reviews.title: Basically Crap. No good after only a new uses
customer_reviews.text: After maybe six total uses, this thing is trash. Will not hold air for more than a couple hours tops. Have taken good care of it to make sure it didn't get punctures etc but obviously there is a big time leak somewhere. You start off on a cushy mattress and end up on the ground three hours later.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sooley

customer_reviews.title: It's comfortable and goes up quick with a battery powered pump
customer_reviews.text: This almost perfectly fits in my tent for those times my wife wants to run outdoors with me, but wants a little extra layer of comfort and luxury. I've had it up in the home and on the trail in the tent and I have not had any punctures or issues with it yet. It's comfortable and goes up quick with a battery powered pump. Seriously, if you camp and you can take your car right to your camping spot, this is a must have. Throw it in the back of your car and air it up when you get there. You'll never sleep better outside.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: I would never buy again
customer_reviews.text: I believe this is my first negative review on anything. I bought 2 blow up mattresses. I was having out of town guest coming in and had a full house so I ordered 2. One of them falled the first time I used it and I thought it was just bad luck, it was flat after the first night and would not hold air. The other one worked fine the first time I used it, for three nights. I just had to use it again this was the second time using it and it did not last the one night. Both of them are now trash. Not happy!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this bed! I was concerned after reading other reviews about it leaking. However, I think they either received a defective mattress or did not read the enclosed informational packet which explains the initial stretching once it’s filled. My 7 & 10 year old have been sleeping and playing hard on this mattress for 3 days and no issues. I slept on it last night and no issues or concerns.
customer_reviews.author: S White

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is really just a basic air mattress but you can't go wrong with the price. We've used ours camping and visiting friends about 10 times now and it still works like new. No loss of air in the night, no signs of wear. Certainly doesn't compare to a real mattress but we're very happy with ours. I'll gladly buy another when this one eventually gives out.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Worked out great; specially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these to set up an outdoor movie theater for a bunch of kids. Worked out great; specially for the price. No one has slept on them over night, so I can't comment on that. They were dance on and jumped on by a dozen toddlers though.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Dickson

customer_reviews.title: It inflated easily with a little air pump I already had (product ...
customer_reviews.text: Item works as expected. I bought it for when my grandchildren visit as an extra “bed”. It inflated easily with a little air pump I already had (product does not come with one). It held it’s air for the entire 5 days they used it and we did not need to pump more air in. However my grand children only have a combined weight total of 90 pounds. A queen size sheet fit perfectly on it and it was easy to deflate and fold back up to store it away in the original box.
customer_reviews.author: Lanora Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable for very long.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for maybe 3 uses, but ended up getting two large, un-patchable holes in it while packed in my trunk. Wasn't particularly rough with it at all. Frankly, I have no idea how it got the holes, I was just very sadly surprised when I went to use it at my destination and it was useless. Did NOT get long term use out of this. Not a particularly durable mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Belzer

customer_reviews.title: 3.5 years & going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bed for many years now and it has been used for camping, overnight guests, and just occasional fun in the back-yard. It has had kids jumping on it, dogs romping around on it, 250 pound people sleeping on it... It still works perfectly. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Skippy

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price - cannot be beat!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these 6 months ago and they have been used several times by various guests. We've had couples, heavyset people, skinny people, families, and everything in between, sleep on these over a number of weekend stays and no-one has ever complained about them not being comfortable enough. Like with any airbed, you will need to put the pump to it for a couple of seconds every night as the material expands and/or a tiny bit of air manages to escape. For the price, this airbed cannot be beat - as long as you treat the airbed with respect (i.e. try not to have kids jumping on it, walking on it with shoes etc) it should last.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Smith

customer_reviews.title: She was very comfortable, and we only had to put extra air ...
customer_reviews.text: My sister slept on this when she came to visit for a week. She was very comfortable, and we only had to put extra air in it on the second night. I guess it was stretched out by then. It's a very nice color and seems to be decent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Krista V.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Two of the 3 I ordered were fine. One lost air.
customer_reviews.text: I saw reviews with people saying that their air mattresses had leaks, and others saying their mattresses were fine. I decided to go ahead and make the purchase since they were a good price. Well, I purchased 3 queen size mattresses for an upcoming family camping trip. 2 of the 3 we purchased held air just fine, the other one was flat as a pancake by morning. So...based on prior reviews and my own experience I would say you have a 66.7% chance of receiving a mattress free of defects, and 33.3% chance of receiving one that will not hold air more than a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: cawalker77

customer_reviews.title: Thick, comfortable, awesome.
customer_reviews.text: This air mattress is really nice. It was very comfortable, despite being shared between my wife, son, and myself on a camping trip. It stayed well inflated all night. It also seemed to be made of nice and thick material, so I didn't really have to worry about popping holes in it while we slept. This is a great buy and I would definitely recommend this over a cheaper one. This is one of those cases where you get what you pay for. And this thing is a pretty good deal to start with.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon L. Terry

customer_reviews.title: Great and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for camping trips and guests over for over a year now. At first I thought it was leak a lot of air over night but it has held up surprising well. Overall very pleased with this purchase. The felt-ish top is a tad hard to clean though, a lint roller for cleaning off dry things and then a soapy paper towel is probably best.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey M. He

customer_reviews.title: Seems like Coleman has no interest in fixing it
customer_reviews.text: This is the Mattress. Does not fail. Does not even need air for nite 2. I am so upset with my family fights over the last 2 decades because of Coleman air mattress. One ruined nite sleep after another. Seems like Coleman has no interest in fixing it. Game my new queen coleman to gardener. Hope he doesnt get mad at me. Intex is the best mattress for camping ---period. be sure to only buy this product for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Harry F.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Did not last one night. Not ONE night! Two average sized adults had it flat in one hour. Can't roll over on it without difficulty. I was looking for something to use for three lousy days while I gave my company my bed. I hate when I pay for something in good faith & it doesn't last one night. My backbone was touching the hardwood floor in the morning. My back has hurt for three days. It is in the trash. Not worth giving away.
customer_reviews.author: Julie M Ireland

customer_reviews.title: So uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I get this is a $20 mattress which is why it gets two stars instead of one. It stayed perfectly inflated which is great (and expected in a new product), but the curves on the mattress are very deep that it is so uncomfortable. I sleep on my back and it was just so lumpy. This is maybe fine if you sleep on your side and you sleep in one of the curves, but I had to sleep on this for 3 nights and it was horrible. I'm 24 and had back pain after every night. I seriously don't know why the top of the mattress isn't just flat. Horrible design
customer_reviews.author: Fotchgirl

customer_reviews.title: But the price is good and it does the job
customer_reviews.text: This is a situation of you get what you pay for. The price can't be beat and we keep these around for when my kids camp or when they have sleepovers. They're fairly uncomfortable and they always get leaks after about a year. But the price is good and it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: M Beck

customer_reviews.title: Product came in perfect condition and exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Product came in perfect condition and exactly as advertised. I am 6' and so is my 13 yr old daughter, total weight about 350 lbs. We blew it up when we received the mattress and had movie night in the living room. As all new air mattresses, it needed to be stretched out before camping. Only had to add air twice. Held up like a champ! We slept in it two nights with no problem. Now her new camping air mattress is stretched out and broken in. Going to order another one for myself. Great buy for the product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This inflates super quickly (I used an electric pump, sold separately). I find it to be pretty comfortable for short term use. It may have lost a little bit of air, but not enough for me to add more. Overall, I've been really happy with this, and the price can't be beat. My only critique is that it takes forever to deflate. Further, though it came in a small box, I'm now unable to fold it small enough to fit back in the box or store compactly. I'm not sure how to store it so that it doesn't get punctured or damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, comfortable, and simple -- great for camping.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for camping trips (remember, you need to buy a separate electric pump to inflate this). It inflated easily using my portable electric pump, and fit easily into my four-person Coleman tent. It makes campouts much more enjoyable, and sleepless nights tossing and turning over rocks are no longer an issue. It's not the MOST comfortable bed ever, but for $15 it works great and is much more comfy than the ground. I would recommend it if you want something for occasional use. Unlike other reviewers, we had no trouble with gradually leaking air.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS ONE;  YOU'LL SPEND YOUR FREE TIME TRYING TO DEFLATE IT (HOURS!)
customer_reviews.text: It is really hard to deflate. I decided to buy the inflator/deflator to get it done and even that does not work. You have to leave it sitting around for a couple of days slowly trickling out air before you can pack it up. I have spent hours trying to deflate it.
customer_reviews.author: Bozo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our needs and the $
customer_reviews.text: We used the product one weekend. Two nights camping. We didn't need to put in more air. Comfortable enough. Though if you sleep with someone else on an airbed, be prepared to feel every time them move. Took it right out the box and filled it. No troubles.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Visiting Guests
customer_reviews.text: Having guests over was made beyond easy thanks to these air beds. They inflated quickly with a pump that we bought ahead of time, held their air well across several nights, and were most importantly - comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: This air mattress did not disappoint. We have had plenty of queen size air ...
customer_reviews.text: This air mattress did not disappoint. We have had plenty of queen size air mattresses and they are so uncomfortable and always need to be refilled on the daily. This mattress was great for our 4 day stay and didn't need refilled once.
customer_reviews.author: LNK

customer_reviews.title: perfect no leaks!
customer_reviews.text: awesome air mattress! I have bought a few of these from walmart and academy sports. 1/2 of the ones i have gotten from walmart and academy over the years have had holes in them right out of the box upon first use. I am pleased to report that this one came perfect! Brand new, never used still had the new rubber air mattress smell! no leaks, worked flawless, and i didnt have to refill with air either. i used it for 2 nights in a row with no problems! my girlfriend and i both slept on it with a combined weight of eoughly 360 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: cstarke

customer_reviews.title: Nice bed ..but ridiculous seller
customer_reviews.text: Ok bed is what is described.. is very comfortable... however.. it came directly from Walmart with price tag of 14.97 .. seller charged 29.xx... seriously if had wanted products from Walmart would of ordered from there to start with
customer_reviews.author: Bikerchick

customer_reviews.title: Not advertized size as well as having no warranty
customer_reviews.text: I received a Queen-sized mattress for which the length was 5" short and the width was 4" short. The mattress sent to me had 9 air chambers; I've seen 7-chambered Intex Queens which were actually the correct size. I wonder if Intex thinks their customers won't measure the mattress or try a fitted sheet on these "Intex Queens". Also, there is no warranty unless you purchase from the Intex website--then you'll get a whopping 30-day warranty.
customer_reviews.author: morpheus

customer_reviews.title: Deflated on first use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this mattress for an extended, 10-day camping trip and unfortunately, on the first use, the mattress nearly completely deflated overnight. We tried following the manufacturers instructions and filled the air mattress first thing in the morning, re-filled the mattress with air around noon, but by evening when we stopped back at the tent, the mattress had nearly deflated. I'm guessing the mattress was defective to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The bed looked as described, really nice. I realize the price is considerably lower compared to other beds which is why we bought it to use once and a while in our trailer. We blew the bed up and before we could actually use it it deflated I’m talking within a day or two. We tried blowing it up a couple of times with the same results. I would not recommend this mattress
customer_reviews.author: dbarilon

customer_reviews.title: this air mattress has been awesome! We've used it probably around 6-8 times for ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this air mattress has been awesome! We've used it probably around 6-8 times for guests. Even though it doesn't come with a pump, we make-shift and use a hairdryer on cold and pump the last quarter by ourselves. The self-pump option isn't great for the entire mattress (unless, perhaps, you're a brass/wind instrument player!), but it does the job. We've added a bit of air each day, but haven't had any serious issues or complaints. If you're looking for a cheap and easy solution for short-term guests, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: KLbright

customer_reviews.title: For the price, no complaints with this Airbed!
customer_reviews.text: I've used it a half-dozen times now. Seems to hold the air just fine but there's a patch included should it get a leak. Loses a star for the difficulty in inflating. I also purchased the quick-fill DC electric pump by Intex but it's all pretty awkward. I also wish this came with some sort of carrying/storage bag. Nonetheless, for the combined price this was still a heck of a lot more affordable than the Aerobed I'd purchased some time ago that leaked and popped out of shape.
customer_reviews.author: MLOEW1979

customer_reviews.title: Durable, easy to use, nice price!
customer_reviews.text: Serves its purpose. It is a replacement of our prior air bed for our camping trips. It fits great in our sleeve it goes into on our Coleman camping bed. It’s like being a hotel bed but instead bed in a tent. No complaints!!
customer_reviews.author: Lucky

customer_reviews.title: It still held the air pretty well. It may use a little air now
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so my fiance would have something to sleep on, other than the sofa, for when his mother visits. We had a coleman pump on hand so inflating it only took 2-3 mins. Once set up I put on a fitted queen sheet. I slept on it for 1 night, my fiance for 4. He didn't complain about sleeping on it other than it was a little chilly. For $15 you can't beat this purchase. We originally inflated it a month or so ago, and left it that way. It still held the air pretty well. It may use a little air now, but no complaints from us.
customer_reviews.author: glisteningcakes

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: I love these air mattresses! Is it the best? No. Is it the lightest? Nope Is it the most comfy? Not a chance but for the price it's the best available. I car camp often enough that I buy my tents to fit this air mattress I do a big 550mi charity bicycle ride where we camp out every night. This sure beat the small flat hiking inflatable air beds after a 100mi day on a bicycle.
customer_reviews.author: jason scott

customer_reviews.title: Look no further, this bed is comfortable for every day use!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great air mattress. I have hip, back and sciatica, and all I have to do with this sturdy, queen sized air mattress is to leave it a little softer so it kinda seems to take pressure off of painful areas. I had to wear a back brace 24 he's a day, even while sleeping and this air mattress was a GREAT AND VERY AFFORDABLE BUY,considering the prices of others! I use it every night!! Plan on buying a couple more as well. DOES NOT COME WITH AIR PUMP THOUGHT that is the only downfall I have whatsoever!!!
customer_reviews.author: BlessedMomma:))

customer_reviews.title: this bed is very easy to store
customer_reviews.text: this bed is very easy to store. it is large enough for two (medium sized) people to sleep on. the bed does not come with an electric pump so please keep in mind to purchase that separately. this bed is comfortable. it does deflate slightly at night, as most air beds do. however, the deflation is not enough to make in uncomfortable. i recommend this bed to those who are looking for something low priced, easy to store and looking for width.
customer_reviews.author: Siddharth S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this air mattress because I was going on vacation and was concerned about the bed being too hard . I was correct - the bed was almost as hard as the floor. I inflated the mattress on top of the bed and slept great. It is light and easy to use. I will take it with me any time I travel.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: I didn't inflate it for 3 days like it says and the first night it stayed fully ...
customer_reviews.text: Okay so last year I bought a $35 form Walmart and it had holes right off. I figured if this cheap one doesn't work I'm not out too much. IT WORKS whaaaaaaat. I didn't inflate it for 3 days like it says and the first night it stayed fully inflated. It did stretch out over the next day but was easy to fill back up. I'm happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: KoKo

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with Pump!
customer_reviews.text: The mattress itself is better than expected- especially for the price -however MAKE SURE YOU HAVE A WAY TO INFLATE IT! Somehow I missed that it did not come with a way to fill it up-
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Ok for two, not one.
customer_reviews.text: Good enough. Hard to keep inflated, lets out over night. Even the initial fill is difficult. You can't get it completely full. It seems to work best with two people, as it evens out the mattress. With only one person you fall to the ground because it can't get full enough. They need a valve like on beachballs that keeps the air in until you squeeze it. Also: note that it does not include the pump.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, best price I have found!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these mattresses last summer with the intention of piling them up on each other. I found them to be very comfortable, held their air as expected (i refilled it weekly, but it was used daily) The quality was good and I'll be able to use them again next summer.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping !!!
customer_reviews.text: Loved the mattress, it keep all air for the 4 days we went camping, I recommend it! But the funny thing was my friend bought the same mattress from Walmart for only $14 so check it out before you buy! Other than that I greatly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sana

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this mattress 0 stars I would. I bought this in November of 2017 and it already has issues. It appears one of the seams has come undone and this has created a bulge in the mattress when airing it up. This mattress is not used often and when it is used it’s for my two daughters (ages 4 and 6) to sleep on during those “scary nights” that kids have. We followed all of the directions when we first got it to make sure it would last us a while. I guess you do get what you pay for, I just wish we would’ve paid more and gotten a better mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Valve is difficult to manage. Mattress is smaller than advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like this air mattress at all. It is so difficult to pump up compared to the Coleman system that I would never buy it again. In addition, I wanted to use it in conjunction with another queen mattress in staging a house. It is shy of 60” and therefore unusable for this purpose. I wish I had something good to say about it, but I don’t.
customer_reviews.author: SMarr

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 3 of these for camping. We didn't have any issues at all. They were easy to blow up (we used a pump that plugged into the car). These were worth EVERY PENNY. They did not deflate at all. They were easy to fit into the tent. I used regular queen size sheets. Since camping, my daughter had a sleepover and again the bed proved to be worth it's weight in gold.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, works very well, held up all night.
customer_reviews.text: I was very glad to find an air mattress that was low to the ground and inexpensive. This fit the bill exactly. I bought two for my family of 4 since we were camping. it worked very well, had to blow it up once in the night but as it says on the package that's to be expected as the fabric stretches, if we had filled it up ahead of time we may not have needed to. Very good value, helps me be able to go camping with my family. Yay for new family hobbies!
customer_reviews.author: Stephannie

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, cheap, and fit in my tent
customer_reviews.text: This airbed was great, it was comfortable and fit in my three person tent. The fuzzy exterior (one side) was nice enough that no bedding was required. The bed does expand for several uses, so it's a little flatter in the morning, make sure to give it some extra pumps the first time you use it to compensate for this. I slept on it for nearly a month indoors, and out, and I felt pretty good (considering) when it was all said and done. Later, a cat poked holes in it something fierce, but a simple $4 repair kit has it still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. don't buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a week long camping trip. Blew it up and left for a few hours. When I came back it was almost flat. I had not even slept on it at all yet! I had to go to the closest town and buy a Coleman which lasted very well through the whole trip. I threw this one in the garbage. No room in the car to haul it back.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa L Clark

customer_reviews.title: Pin hole Air bed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a camping trip. Intex usually manufactures good products so I didn't bother testing before bringing. I woke up and found that I lost all air within a hour of being aired up. I reinflated and found a pin hole so I patched it up. Woke up another hour later same thing, ended up finding 3 pin holes all together but only 1 patch was included so I ended up having to sleep on the ground. My friend had purchased one as well for the trip and the same thing happened to him. Make sure you air this up before you bring it with you, my recommendation is don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: Cardinals Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great option for most uses
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camp mattress, keeps us off the ground and gives a comfortable sleep surface. I have a taller version with a foam topper to use as a guest bed, but this one is pretty good too.
customer_reviews.author: GS

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect - no leak
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect, hold the air. Never had any problems and use it for over a year now. Make sure to close the valve tightly - otherwise it leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Note the 2 part valve to keep it from leaking
customer_reviews.text: Carry out the instructions to let it breathe for 3 days. Make sure the inner ring collar is tight before you inflate and you will be good to go. I love the soft top and the pliable plastic used. More comfortable than much more expensive beds. I have 2 stacked for daily use and can take one along easily for camping. My dogs love this bed! Plenty of room for all of us! No leaks so far.
customer_reviews.author: Whimscycle

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE, LOVE MY AIR MATTRESSES!
customer_reviews.text: I slept on an air mattress for the first time, on a camping trip. It was the absolute best night's sleep I've ever had! I have been sleeping on air mattresses ever since! I stack therm two or three for added height. Of all the air mattresses, this baffled one is the most comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: gussiebee

customer_reviews.title: I am so glad i picked this up
customer_reviews.text: I saw the same one for sale at BassPro for twice the price. I am so glad i picked this up. I had some sort of Kelty one that had a built in pump. It constantly leaked air. Dont know where from and Kelty even sent us another and that leaked too. This was super simple and stayed just as full of air for a 2 night trip, no refilling. I am really pleased with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Frugal Gearist

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bed
customer_reviews.text: GREAT AIR MATTRESS!!! my brother sent me the link to this bed because we were going camping and he said he had the same 1. We got it the day before we left for camping and just got back and we loved it. We always go to the ae spot and have used the small self inflating mats but this air mattress was a way better idea. It was very comfortable and durable. It has a thick material so we didn't have to worry about getting holes. It stayed aired up all 4 nights and didn't have to re air it up once.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for guests!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this mattress for any guests that didn't want to drive home late at night or didn't want to sleep on the sofa. It works great and my grand kids even love it when they are over on the weekends!
customer_reviews.author: stargazerlily

customer_reviews.title: Defective and doesn't hold air
customer_reviews.text: This product is junk. I've bought two of them and niether holds air past one night. I thought that maybe the first one was punctured from use as we took it camping. But the second one I bought performed worse than the first. It deflates after a few hours and doesnt hold air. I've used it twice in my living room and now have to throw this one away too as the exchange window is closed. Terrible product. Amazon should let me return it as it is defective.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: depends on use
customer_reviews.text: you get what you pay for here. i bought two over the course of 3 months, and each one ended up leaking. both leaked in the same place, in the seam on the flocking, and one couldn't be fixed. the segments would randomly release from their moorings and i'd end up with large pockets of air. but for the price, it was worth it. if you are looking for something that will hold up under heavy use, this won't last you very long, if you need it for occasional use, for the price you can't really beat it.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Eventually a hole with form and it will get replaced like all air up mattresses
customer_reviews.text: I don's see a need in getting a high dollar air up mattress. Eventually a hole with form and it will get replaced like all air up mattresses. It's very well constructed but I just know it will need to be replaced sooner or later. And next time I'll buy the exact same one. Doesn't come with a pump of any sort so you'll need to purchase one or dig in the closed for one from the more expensive mattress that has a hole in it now.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Watts

customer_reviews.title: Great mattress. Inflates and deflates easily
customer_reviews.text: Great mattress. Inflates and deflates easily. Holds air well through temperature fluctuations as well. As comfortable as one can expect an air mattress to be. Makes sleeping on rough camp surfaces a breeze and definitely adds to the comfort of an outdoorsy lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: Rishi

customer_reviews.title: One of the worst nights of sleep in my 42 years on this Earth
customer_reviews.text: It leaks. Badly. Won't last longer than an hour before some part of my body hits the ground. Of course, I'm currently writing this at Yosemite's Housekeeping Camp, in the middle of the night (good job TMobile LTE). I haven't slept a wink. This is awful.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: I order this because we were going on a trip I needed an extra bed. Before we left I blew it up to try it out and it seemed very comfortable. However when I actually used it it wasn't as comfortable as I thought. The material on the top of the mattress makes it really warm at night so you feel between a cold or hot feeling. And I was under the impression that it came with a pump which it does not so you have to make sure you order one. I would definitely recommend the item, you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: isa

customer_reviews.title: Great for short term sleeping.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice inflatable mattress with a soft, down-like topping layer. Easy to inflate and deflate, and stores away at a reasonable size. My friends said it was decently comfortable for a few nights, and we didn't have any problems with it losing air overnight. Probably not great for sleeping on long term. A few days max.
customer_reviews.author: Disastar

customer_reviews.title: ... one time only when we went camping and I like it. My wife has neck problems and she ...
customer_reviews.text: I used it one time only when we went camping and I like it. My wife has neck problems and she didn't have any problems when she woke up the next day. It's nice and big. I only wish the surface was flat like a real bed rather than being 8 rows of tubes. was easy to air and deflate as well. Not sure how long it will last but if you put a tarp under it and don't use it as a trampoline, it should last a a few uses at least. For $20, don't expect this to be your permanent mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Mak

customer_reviews.title: It is extremely comfortable and frankly hard to get off when I wake ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this bed (I wanted a back-up)i have slept on this mattress (in my pool) for the last 5 summers, and no I don't worry about drowning because I have never fallen out of bed in my 70 years. It is extremely comfortable and frankly hard to get off when I wake up and want to get out of the pool
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Thin bed. To be expected though
customer_reviews.text: It's a single layer, so it goes without saying.. But it tends to get flat throughout the night. Even the first time being used. Id suggest just paying alittle more and getting the double panel bed. Save your back the pain
customer_reviews.author: paige

customer_reviews.title: Works, cheap but reliable, does not come with pump
customer_reviews.text: Cheap work as intended. We're couple avg 15-170lbs and used it several times during our camping trips and staying over at friend's place and it never fails to impress us. Definitely worth to buy it. (It does not come with the pump but I had one from previous air mattress but this is something you should consider before buying it)
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Nice, simple air mattresses
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality air mattresses. We didn't feel like splurging on something that we may only use once every blue moon. We bought three only the units to use over the course of four nights, and are happy with the level of comfort and how they remained inflated. We only needed to top one off after the first night. These will be good to use when our children have sleep overs. My only desire would be for a carrying bag of some sort to use rather than the box they came with.
customer_reviews.author: fuel98rider

customer_reviews.title: Better than a Coleman
customer_reviews.text: I have had multiple Coleman air mattresses leak during just the second use. This air mattress has lasted a few years being used 2-3 camping trips per season. I role it around a 7' cardboard tube for storage rather than folding it up tight.
customer_reviews.author: 186xt

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor and buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: We have used many air mattresses during moves and at all different price points. This was the most inexpensive one we have bought and it has lasted us the best. It made it through a few weeks of needing to use it until our household goods arrived! I could kick myself for spending so much on other mattresses that failed us repeatedly!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: be prepared to inflate it every day or 2 days
customer_reviews.text: They will tell you that you first have to inflate it and then when it settles (or stretch?) you may think you have an air leak but it's not. WRONG. You will be inflating this every day or 2
customer_reviews.author: Juni

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase!
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this last minute for a friend that was staying over and boy did I make a good purchase... Both my friend and daughter slept on it and said it felt just like a bed. I can't speak to the durability yet, since I've only used it for that weekend, but they slept on it for 2 nights and didn't want to get up! I wouldn't say that this should be used daily but if you are looking for something to have for guests here and there, I think you will get a good bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Girlygirl30

customer_reviews.title: These worked great for camping
customer_reviews.text: These worked great for camping. Easy to blow up with an electric pump. The instructions said to fill them with more air after the first day because they would stretch more. However, we only camped for two days, and never needed to add air. We had one size large female adult and one small child on the one and a size large male and medium female on the other. Plenty of space and great comfort!
customer_reviews.author: MWB6

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for camping and was easy to inflate. We used the manual pump that came with our inflatable kayak and it was easy. Waaaay better than sleeping on the ground and didn’t take up as much room as some of the thicker versions on the market. Didn’t have any issues with deflating either we did have to add a bit more air the second night out of the box but not again after that
customer_reviews.author: Eclair

customer_reviews.title: Owned Less than 1 month but I think it's Great!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great air mattress. I've only had it for a short period of time (< 1month). However, I only needed it for a weekend. It was comfortable and very reasonably priced. I'm glad I made this purchase. I already had a battery operated pump. So keep in mind this does not come with a pump. You will need to purchase one separately. In all, I'd recommend this mattress to anyone who needs a short term bed. I am thinking of purchasing another just to have a back up (in case this doesn't have longevity).
customer_reviews.author: K. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Inflatable queen size portable bed
customer_reviews.text: Works well and the price was right. Bought a few for the large family gathering and all were fine; no leaks and inflated and deflated quickly. The value texture was good and allowed the slip cover not to slip off. Better than a cot.
customer_reviews.author: Berns

customer_reviews.title: They don’t last long!
customer_reviews.text: I want to give this 2.5 stars cause I bought 2 queen air mattresses for camping and one blew out on our 2 night and it was not over inflated! I wish it could of at least gotten us they our 7 day trip!
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Good for price for camping!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy, quick to inflate with a pump. Velvety side helps pillows and blankets to stay in place overnight. Sleep 2 comfortably (could fit a child in too, but it would be a bit tighter). Punctured mine on a nail at my campsite under the tent, but a rubber patch repair kit made it good as new. Otherwise, small bits of sticks and tiny stones that have gotten into my tent haven't damaged this in any way. Construction is reasonably sturdy to survive normal, average camping situations.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is great. The fill valve is designed to keep the air from leaking out as you fill. The end screws off to let the air out quickly. Not the most comfortable mattress you can get, but for a 2 night camping trip, it will work. Only issue I have is that the ridges make it a little different to lay on. My son jumped on it as I filled it tonight to test it, and it held up to the abuse. However, I wouldn't suggest jumping or plopping down on it.
customer_reviews.author: Shanny

customer_reviews.title: They are very nice for the price we paid !!
customer_reviews.text: It's 4 star because you can buy two for the price of branded one. I have now used them several times(it's my second year of camping) and my kids jump on them when they are setup. Only complain is that they loose some air every time we have used them for camping, which turning sides difficult. But given a choice I would buy them again for occasional use. If you camp or plan to use very often, i'll prefer going with a better one.
customer_reviews.author: N. sharma

product_meta.title: Intex Classic Downy Airbed, Queen
product_meta.description:
Location, temperature, and humidity will affect the airbed's firmness. Airbeds will need to be occasionally re-inflated (topped off) to maintain desired firmness when used for more than a few days as vinyl tends to relax over time., Measurements will vary based on customer's inflation. Airbeds are measured from the widest point including the beams (bulges) on the side and off the tallest point from the floor including built-in pillows if applicable., Inflatable queen-sized airbed for indoor and outdoor use with hi-output manual hand pump, Cozy flocked top cleans easily and is waterproofed for camping use, Wave beam construction for a uniform sleeping surface, 2-in-1 valve with extra-wide opening for fast inflation/deflation, Measures 60 by 8.75 by 80 inches (WxHxD); 600-pound weight capacity

AMAZON.COM


 INTEX CLASSIC DOWNY AIRBED 
With plush flocking on the top, the queen-sized Classic Downy airbed from Intex provides a softer sleeping surface that also helps keep bedding from slipping off the mattress. Crafted with durable heavy gauge vinyl, the cozy flocked top cleans easily and is waterproofed for camping use. The quality-tested bed is constructed with a 20.8-gauge waterproof flocked top, along with 14-gauge vinyl beams, and 15-gauge sides and bottom. With a 2-in-1 valve with an extra wide opening, inflation or deflation is quick and easy.

The Classic Downy bed is raised 8.75 inches from the floor, and at 60 by 8.75 by 80 inches (WxHxD) is an official Queen-sized mattress--ensuring a tight fit for fitted sheets. The Classic Downy bed has a 600-pound weight capacity. It folds compactly for storage. Spot clean with mild soap and water.
feature_bullets: Dimensions: 60 x 8.75 x 80 inches (W x H x L), 600-Pound capacity

Inflatable queen airbed suitable for indoor or outdoor use.Plush, waterproof, flocked top with wave beam construction for comfort and durability.New airbeds can take up to 72 hours to fully stretch or “break-in”
2-in-1 valve with extra-wide opening makes inflation and deflation easy and quick. Inflates with most manual or electric air pumps (Pump not included)
Standard queen size provides a good fit when using fitted sheets

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
